commitResults.messageTitle: added greet method
added exit method
added lines into greet and exit method, for visual
added printLine function for easier access to horizontal lines
Level 1. Greet, Echo, Exit. Added echo() function
added converse switch function that looks at user input and uses different methods based on that. added listTasks: to list all tasks on hand. added addList: to add tasks to the list
Added Task Class. Modified current functions in Duke Class to use Task Class
added markTask and unMarkTask methods to mark and unmark tasks respectively. Also changed switch statement default case to look out for the words "mark" and/or "unmark"
touched up on code syntax and wording
updated code format using IntelliJ's Ctrl + Alt + L

Shifted welcome message to a method on its own Renamed list (array) to tasks Changed if else statements to switch statement based on command (1st word of input) Removed default constructor for Task class with no parameters as there is no need for it Introduced Todo, Deadline and Event classes (subclass of Task class)
Automated Text UI Testing Updated EXPECTED.TXT and input.TXT
Reformatted code to improve code quality

1. renamed welcomeMessage() to showWelcomeMessage() as a verb 2. moved a chunk of converse(), particularly the switch statements, into a new method runCommand() 3. created new UnknownCommandException class 4. For runCommand(), replaced default message to throw an UnknownCommandException, converse() would have try catch blocks 5. implemented ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException handling for mark and unmarkTask methods. In case users forget to type index 6. Implemented NullPointerException for Task class, to raise an error if there is a missing description for any task (todo/deadline/event)
Created packages duke and exceptions. All classes except UnknownCommandException is in duke package
Created packages duke and exceptions. All classes except UnknownCommandException is in duke package

1. Replaced tasks array type to ArrayList<Task> from collections 2. moved code in runCommand (case deadline, case event) into separate methods addDeadline() and addEvent() 3. created new method deleteTask to delete tasks from the list 4. modified code in various areas to adapt to ArrayList<> requirements

1. Introduced TaskFile Manager (reused code from FaliciaOng) 2. Modified task classes to be able to save string to file via toFileString() method 3. Changed markTask and unmarkTask to return boolean values for hasUpdate variable
Updated bugs in runcommand method (missing hasUpdate and hasAddedTask update)
Introduced Ui class, moved ui relevant methods from Duke class to Ui class
introduced TaskList class in accordance to project requirements. This class essentially holds an arraylist, and methods are to make contact with the arraylist

Created new Storage class which is essentially TaskFileManager class, to read and save files into a textfile used as a database. It only stores one attribute that is the filepath to the textfile database.
minor format edits to the Storage class
Deleted TaskFileManager class since Storage class is its replacement
minor format edits to UI class
minor format edits to storage class
removed unnecessary methods now that we have Storage class
implemented storage class and tasklist class into Duke main class. also reformatted runcommand() method to connect with tasklist and storage
output file from current code.
Shifted bulk of Duke Main class code into new Parser class. Parser class is used to intepret commands
added code to help instantiate Parser class
added getDoneStatus() method in Task class to help communicate with Parser class
output code for testing - works
implemented find method in Parser class
added getDesciption method in Task class for the sake of find method in Parser class
added findFromList method in TaskList class which is used by find method in Parser class
Added JavaDoc
